title: oc2slpf version 1.0 json schema
description: This schema is intended to validate all possible content for the OpenC2 Stateless Packet Filter version 1.0

oneOf.description: A message defined by an Action-Target pair that is sent from a Producer and received by a Consumer
A message from a Consumer to a Producer acknowledging a Command or returning the requested resources or status to a previously received Command

OpenC2_Command.title: OpenC2 Command
OpenC2_Command.description: The Command defines an Action to be performed on a Target

action.description: The task or activity to be performed (i.e., the 'verb')

target.description: The object of the Action. The Action is performed on the Target

args.description: Additional information that applies to the Command

actuator.description: The subject of the Action. The Actuator executes the Action on the Target

status_text.description: A free-form human-readable description of the response status

results.description: Map of key:value pairs that contain additional results based on the invoking Command

oneOf.description: Initiate a request for information. Used to communicate the supported options and determine the state or settings
Prevent traffic or access
Permit traffic or access
Instructs the Actuator to update its configuration by retrieving and processing a configuration file and update
Remove an access rule

features.description: A set of items such as Action/Target pairs, profiles versions, options that are supported by the Actuator. The Target is used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities

ipv4_net.description: The representation of one or more IPv4 addresses expressed using CIDR notation

ipv6_net.description: The representation of one or more IPv6 addresses expressed using CIDR notation

ipv4_connection.description: a network connection as specified by a five-tuple (IPv4)

ipv6_connection.description: A network connection as specified by a five-tuple (IPv4)

slpf:rule_number.description: Immutable identifier assigned when a rule is created. Identifies a rule to be deleted

slpf.description: Actuator specifiers defined in the Stateless Packet Filtering profile. A message can specify many Actuator types but for it to validate with this profile it must at least specify SLPF

start_time.description: The specific date/time to initiate the action

stop_time.description: The specific date/time to terminate the action

duration.description: The length of time for an action to be in effect

response_requested.description: The type of Response required for the Command: none, ack, status, complete

slpf.description: Command arguments defined in the Stateless Packet Filter profile

oneOf.description: Processing - an interim response used to inform the Producer that the Consumer has accepted the Command but has not yet completed it
OK - the Command has succeeded
Bad Request - the Consumer cannot process the Command due to something that is perceived to be a Producer error (e.g., malformed Command syntax)
Internal Error - the Consumer encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from performing the Command
Not Implemented - the Consumer does not support the functionality required to perform the Command

versions.description: List of OpenC2 language versions supported by this Actuator

profiles.description: list of profiles supported by this actuator

pairs.description: List of Targets applicable to each supported Action

rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests per minute supported by design or policy

slpf.description: Response types defined in the Stateless Packet Filter profile

Features.title: OpenC2 Features Items
Features.description: An array of zero to ten names used to query an Actuator for its supported capabilities

name.description: The name of the file as defined in the file system

path.description: The absolute path to the location of the file in the file system

hashes.description: One or more cryptographic hash codes of the file contents

IPv4_Net.title: OpenC2 IPv4 Net
IPv4_Net.description: IPv4 address as defined in [RFC0791] - CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address

protocol.description: Layer 4 protocol (e.g., TCP) - see L4_Protocol section

IPv6_Net.title: OpenC2 IPv6 Net
IPv6_Net.description: IPv6 address as defined in [RFC8200] - CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address

protocol.description: Layer 4 protocol (e.g., TCP) - see L4_Protocol section

Action_Targets.title: OpenC2 Action Target Pairs
Action_Targets.description: Map of each action supported by this Actuator to the list of Targets applicable to the specific Action

oneOf.description: A network connection as specified by a five-tuple (IPv4)
A network connection as specified by a five-tuple (IPv6)
The representation of one or more IPv4 addresses expressed using CIDR notation
The representation of one or more IPv6 addresses expressed using CIDR notation
A network connection as specified by a five-tuple (IPv4)
A network connection as specified by a five-tuple (IPv6)
The representation of one or more IPv4 addresses expressed using CIDR notation
The representation of one or more IPv6 addresses expressed using CIDR notation

query.description: Initiate a request for information. Used to communicate the supported options and determine the state or settings

oneOf.description: A set of items such as Action/Target pairs, profiles versions, options that are supported by the Actuator. The Target is used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities
Immutable identifier assigned when a rule is created. Identifies a rule to be deleted

update.description: Instructs the Actuator to update its configuration by retrieving and processing a configuration file and update

oneOf.description: Properties of a file

Date_Time.title: OpenC2 Date Time
Date_Time.description: Date and Time - milliseconds since 00:00:00 UTC, 1 January 1970

Duration.title: OpenC2 Duration
Duration.description: A length of time - number of milliseconds

oneOf.description: List of OpenC2 Language versions supported by this Actuator
List of profiles supported by this Actuator
List of supported Actions and applicable Targets
Maximum number of Commands per minute supported by design or policy

Hostname.title: OpenC2 Hostname
Hostname.description: Internet host name as specified in [RFC1123]

L4_Protocol.title: OpenC2 layer four protocol
L4_Protocol.description: Value of the protocol (IPv4) or next header (IPv6) field in an IP packet. Any IANA value - [RFC5237]

oneOf.description: Internet Control Message Protocol - [RFC0792]
Transmission Control Protocol - [RFC0793]
User Datagram Protocol - [RFC0768]
Stream Control Transmission Protocol - [RFC4960]

Nsid.title: Namespace Identifier
Nsid.description: A short identifier that refers to a namespace

oneOf.description: No response
Respond when Command received
Respond with progress toward Command completion
Respond when all aspects of Command completed

drop_process.description: Specifies how to handle denied packets

persistent.description: Normal operations assume any changes to a device are to be implemented persistently. Setting the persistent modifier to FALSE results in a change that is not persistent in the event of a reboot or restart

direction.description: Specifies whether to apply rules to incoming or outgoing traffic. If omitted, rules are applied to both

insert_rule.description: Specifies the identifier of the rule within a list, typically used in a top-down rule list

oneOf.description: Drop the packet and do not send a notification to the source of the packet
Drop the packet and send an ICMP host unreachable (or equivalent) to the source of the packet
Drop the traffic and send a false acknowledgment
Apply rules to all traffic
Apply rules to incoming traffic only
Apply rules to outgoing traffic only

slpf:Rule_ID.title: SLPF access rule identifier
slpf:Rule_ID.description: Immutable identifier assigned when a rule is created. Identifies a rule to be deleted

hostname.description: [RFC1123] hostname (can be a domain name or IP address) for a particular device with SLPF functionality

named_group.description: User defined collection of devices with SLPF functionality

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for a particular SLPF

asset_tuple.description: Unique tuple identifier for a particular SLPF consisting of a list of up to 10 strings

rule_number.description: Rule identifier returned from allow or deny Command
